message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.SI 

This paper is about active learning, which is a subfield of machine learning. The paper discusses a framework for actively and adaptively solving a sequence of machine learning problems, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of "Machine Learning" (cs.LG). The paper also mentions the use of stochastic gradient descent, which is a common optimization algorithm used in deep learning, suggesting that it could also belong to the sub-category of "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI). The experiments presented in the paper involve both synthetic and real data, which could suggest that it belongs to the sub-categories of "Computer Vision" (cs.CV) or "Computation and Language" (cs.CL). Finally, the paper discusses the construction of an estimator for the change in the learning problems, which could suggest that it belongs to the sub-category of "Social and Information Networks" (cs.SI), as this sub-category often deals with modeling and analyzing changes in networks or systems.
